greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k), n>=k>=1, is the number of triangles with integer coordinates that have a bounding box of size n X k.
comment: It appears that the main diagonal is 4*A000326.
link: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9870 (the first 140 rows)
example: A right angle is marked 'r', an obtuse one 'o'.
xo.   r.x   x.x   x.r   x..   x..   .ox   .r.   ..x   ..x
..x   x..   .r.   ..x   r.x   .ox   x..   x.x   xo.   x.r
xref: See A279415 for right isosceles triangles.
See A280639 for obtuse isosceles triangles.
See A279418 for acute isosceles triangles.
See A279413 for all isosceles triangles.
See A279433 for all right triangles.
See A280652 for all obtuse triangles.
See A280653 for all acute triangles.
